item.title: Experience the flavors of an Italian Christmas at Casa Ferrero in Singapore
item.description: This year, Ferrero, the maker of Ferrero Rocher chocolates, has brought a touch of Italian Christmas magic to Singapore. Casa Ferrero, their only Southeast Asian pop-up shop, exudes elegance. The shop’s design echoes the gold of the classic Ferrero Rocher praline, enhanced by sparkling crystal chandeliers, the inviting aroma of espresso, and the distinct essence of roasted hazelnuts. Located outside the Wisma Atria mall along Orchard Road in Singapore, Casa Ferrero is even larger than last year’s pop-up, Pasticceria Ferrero.

item.title: During the festive season, you can find exclusive Ferrero Rocher pralines at Pasticceria Ferrero in Singapore
item.description: Celebrities Qi Yu Wu and Joanne Peh are pictured at the event. Ferrero Rocher has opened its first Southeast Asia store, Pasticceria Ferrero, at Singapore’s Wisma Atria on Orchard Road. This unique boutique is the only one in the world and will be open for the holiday season. A sneak peek before the official opening. The shop offers a unique experience, allowing customers to personalize chocolate boxes with limited-edition Ferrero pralines available only during this special time of year.

item.title: The ideal location for candy in Indonesia
item.description: Perfetti Van Melle Indonesia PT is a dominant player in the Indonesian confectionery market, particularly recognized for its Mentos brand. According to a report on the Indonesian confectionery sector by market research firm Euromonitor, the wide array of inexpensive sugary treats, combined with robust marketing campaigns from prominent manufacturers, has propelled sales in this category within Indonesia. Holding a commanding 23% market share in 2016, Perfetti Van Melle Indonesia PT remains the leader in the sugar confectionery sector.

item.title: Gum continues to be a profitable product in Indonesia
item.description: Indonesia experienced growth in the gum confectionery market in 2016, primarily driven by better distribution channels for gum products, particularly chewing gum, facilitated by the expansion of modern retail stores. Market research firm Euromonitor notes that consumers are increasingly drawn to the advantages of gum, such as breath freshening and teeth whitening properties. Euromonitor reports that PT Perfetti Van Melle Indonesia maintained its dominance in the gum market, holding a 58% value share in 2016.
